job_title: Electrical & IT Tool Hook up Engineer
job_description:
• 8-10 years of proven experience in electrical & IT hookup within high-tech, cleanroom, or semiconductor manufacturing industries.
• Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Electronics & Communication, or a related field.
• Hands-on experience with hookup of process tools, servers, sensors, and auxiliary systems.
• Experience in working under ISO cleanroom standards (Class 100 – Class 10,000).
• Excellent troubleshooting, communication, and project coordination skills.
• Strong knowledge of LV/MV power systems, PLC/SCADA communication, and industrial IT networks.
• Familiarity with grounding schemes, UPS backup systems, and cleanroom-compatible materials.
• Knowledge of fiber optics, structured cabling (Cat6/Cat7), and patch panel management.

• Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
• Proven experience in developing mobile applications that require hardware integration, such as smart glasses, including familiarity with Bluetooth or other communication protocols.
• Understanding of responsive design principles and experience in creating intuitive, user-friendly mobile interfaces.
• Strong troubleshooting and debugging skills, with the ability to optimize mobile app performance and battery efficiency.
• Clear and effective written and verbal communication skills, with a demonstrated ability to collaborate successfully with cross-functional teams, including hardware engineers and UX/UI designers.
• Knowledge of UI/UX design principles and the ability to work closely with designers to implement seamless user experiences.
• Preferred qualificationsExperience with augmented reality (AR) or virtual reality (VR) technologies and frameworks, such as ARKit, ARCore, or Unity.
• Experience in developing applications that utilize sensors and other hardware components, such as cameras, accelerometers, and gyroscopes.

• This requires a detailed understanding of chip and system architecture, design, implementation, and component-level reliability.
• Serve as the DFX/reliability champion and evangelist to align the broader industry ecosystem with OpenAI’s requirements and roadmap.
• BS with 15+ years, MS with 10+ years, or PhD with 3+ years of relevant industry experience focused on reliability across the chip/platform stack.
• Hands-on experience with RTL design and DFT is required.
• Physical implementation and/or silicon ATE experience is preferred.
• Detailed understanding of ML chip and platform architecture and ML workload characteristics is required.
• Strong fundamentals in reliability modeling, with hands-on skills in empirical data analysis.
• Oversee DFX architecture, implementation, and execution in silicon from concept to high-volume deployment, and propose high-ROI features to enhance reliability and fault tolerance.

• Own challenges end-to-end, proactively addressing gaps and acquiring new skills to resolve complex issues.
• Are passionate about crafting exceptional developer experiences and creating inspirational technical content and projects.
• Bring a robust full-stack engineering background with demonstrated experience building innovative applications using AI and large language models (LLMs).
• Have strong user empathy and care deeply about delivering experiences developers truly appreciate.
• Develop demos and sample applications demonstrating cutting-edge integrations and best practices using reasoning models, multimodal capabilities, and agent tools.
• Create high-quality technical content—including tutorials, blog posts, videos, and code samples—to educate and inspire the developer community about our models, APIs, and Codex.
• Actively engage with and foster a vibrant local and global developer ecosystem around OpenAI’s platform.
• Represent OpenAI at developer events and online platforms, serving as a knowledgeable, approachable advocate for developers.
